topic.title: Organizations
topic.p: Organizations provide top-level structuring of all entities in Qodana Cloud.
When you create an account, you become a member of your personal organization, which lets you create your projects and aggregate your Qodana reports.
To collaborate with other Qodana Cloud users, you can:

li.a: Be invited to join an existing organization

chapter.title: Organization overview
chapter.p: To manage organizations, navigate to Settings | Manage organization.
This section is related to the active organization and describes the number of teams and members, organization type, subscription plan, and the number of contributors.
You can click the number of members to open the Add people to organization window and manage users of the organization.

chapter.title: Create an organization
chapter.p: You can create either private or public organizations. Private organizations are available only for invited users. Reports of public organizations are available for all Qodana Cloud users.
To create an organization, expand the list of organizations and then click Create organization.
This will open the Add organization window.

chapter.title: Manage members and visibility
chapter.p: If your account has the Administrator for specific organizations, it lets you create and delete such organizations, as well as manage their members and visibility.
To manage members and visibility of the existing organization, on the Organizations tab click the Manage members and visibility link. Using the Invite people to <organization_name> window, you can:

list.li: Invite new users to this organization and assign their roles
